sources.title: Navajo (Drama, 1952) Norman Foster | Documentary
sources.description:
An extraordinary warm, human motion picture - the tender story of an Indian boy alone, afraid of a white man's world!  A young Navajo Indian boy is caught up in the conflict of cultures when he rejects the white man's school. Told in semi-documentary style.
 
Director & Writer: Norman Foster
Stars: Francis Kee Teller, John Mitchell, Mrs. Kee Teller
Genres: Classics, Documentary, Drama


00:00 Full Movie
01:10 Exploration of Navajo history, legends, and struggles in the canyon of Segee.
08:52 A young Navajo boy struggles with his hatred towards white men and fears of being sent to a white man's school.
15:45 Struggles of a Navajo family in a harsh desert environment haunted by past tragedies.
24:45 A dramatic portrayal of a Navajo boy's experience with loss, culture clash, and assimilation.
33:50 A young Navajo boy embarks on a journey to find his family after a tragic event.
44:46 A young Navajo boy evades capture by white men in a treacherous canyon.
1:00:14 A story of survival and redemption unfolds as a Navajo man overcomes darkness and chooses to help his enemies.


@CultCinemaClassics
